result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Stephen Donald Willett in court.  James D Babbitt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 16CF6, 16CF7, 16CF45, 16CF58, 16CF5, 16CF96, 16CM6.  DE is not present, Atty Willett presents medical records to the court, these will be marked exhibit number one.  Court will allow this final adjourment for sentencing per Atty Willetts request,  informs parties this will be the final adjournment.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 1, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Linda P Kroll in court with attorney Stephen Donald Willett.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 16CF6, 16CF7, 16CF45, 16CF58, 16CF5, 16CF96, 16CM6. Defendant Linda P Kroll in court with attorney Stephen Donald Willett.  Defendant Linda P Kroll in custody.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 16CF6, 16CF7. 16CF45, 16CF58, 16CF59, 16CF96, 16CM6.  16CF45, 16CF58, 16CF59, 16CF96 all Preliminary Hearings.  DE/Atty will waive PH. Court instructs on waiver of PH, court will accept waiver.  Court reviews complaints, finds probable cause exists, will bind over for JT in all cases.  Information filed by the State.  Will proceed to arraignment.  Waive reading of all informations, enter a plea of NG to all counts.  Set for plea/sentencing 7/05/16 @ 3:30PM.  Atty would like to address the issue of bond in 16CF96.  State will stand mute.  $5000.00 sign bond, Absolutely no contact with Sandy Prouty. 16CF45 bond will be concurrent in all cases.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 5, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

No contact with Sandra Prouty or N2714 Park St., Conrath.  All bonds concurrent.  No contact with Damien Kramer.  Defendant is not to possess or consume any medications not prescribed by a physician.  Not to possess or consume any illicit substances.  Must be enrolled in substance abuse counseling at Aurora, and must continue contact with Jeremy Jacobs.  DE will do PBT testing or UA at SD every day.  Will do between 7:15/7:30 every day.
Court instructs
